meanings.definition: Behaving or looking as though one thinks one is superior to others.
meanings.sent1: She gave a supercilious smile to show she thought she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The supercilious attitude of the rich man made others feel small.
meanings.sent3: The supercilious cat looked down on the other pets in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her supercilious behavior was like a dark cloud overshadowing the party.
meanings.sent5: The supercilious queen ruled over her subjects with a cold and distant air.

meanings.sent1: He had a supercilious expression that made others feel unworthy.
meanings.sent2: The supercilious tone in her voice made it clear she thought she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent3: The supercilious student refused to work with his classmates on the group project.
meanings.sent4: Her supercilious behavior was like a wall blocking any chance of friendship.
meanings.sent5: The supercilious businessman looked down on those who couldn't afford his products.
